newsitem.title: GREECE: EIB SETS UP 200BLN DRACHMA DEBT ISSUANCE PROGRAMME.
newsitem.headline: EIB SETS UP 200BLN DRACHMA DEBT ISSUANCE PROGRAMME.

text.p: The European Investment Bank (EIB) signed an accord with arranger, state NIBID bank , and other participating banks to set up the first-ever, up to 200 billion drachma, debt issuance programme (DIP), it said.
"The EIB finalised today in Athens arrangements for the first ever Greek drachma debt issuance programme (DIP)," it said in a statement.

"Documentation for up to 200 billion drachma programme was signed by EIB Vice-President, Panayiotis Yennimatas, and NIBID managing director, Dimitris Pavlakis, as well as representatives of the participating banks," it said.

The new facility provides for a wide variety of funding instruments, including fixed-rate, floating-rate and zero-coupon issues and will contribute to the development of the Greek capital market, it added.
"The programme is subject to reverse equity, so that other financial institutions, including institutional investors, may equally join later on," it said.

EIB lent 721 million ecus to Greece in 1996 and has currently four bond issues outstanding in the drachma market maturing in March 1999 and 2000, it added. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
